items.sentence: I assume we\'re doing a pretty good job since no one has complained.
The unemployment rate in Japan was 3.4 percent in September of 2015.
Tom and Mary are both determined to make the best of this situation.
Tom has been hunting for a job ever since he lost his job last year.
Tom is still using the wallet I gave him on his thirteenth birthday.
When I was about to leave my house, I got a telephone call from her.
I have two dogs and I try to feed them each the same amount of food.
I parked on the left side of the street just in front of the school.
I read somewhere that short people need more sleep than tall people.
I thought it was a mistake to tell Tom where we buried the treasure.
I thought it would be an opportunity for you to improve your French.
My mother asked me not to feed the dog until after we had all eaten.
People have the tendency to speak more loudly when they get excited.
The police believe that Tom may have fallen asleep behind the wheel.
The suspect was taken to the police station for further questioning.
I don\'t think I\'ll have enough time to do everything I want to do.
I don\'t think Tom will be able to do what you\'re asking him to do.
I can\'t believe you\'re eating what the doctor told you not to eat.
The other day you said you lost your umbrella. Did you ever find it?
Tom bought a bottle of vodka and some perfume at the duty-free shop.
